bug.short_desc: Update mumble to latest upstream version
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext: Description of problem: Mumble in the Fedora repositories is outdated. Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 1.2.11 How reproducible: Compare mumble from the Fedora 24 update repository with upstream version. Steps to Reproduce: 1. dnf info mumble|grep Version 2. Compare result to http://blog.mumble.info/ Actual results: Version : 1.2.11 Expected results: Latest stable version from upstream (currently 1.2.17) Additional info: Mumble in the Fedora repos has been 11 month without updates. It's therefore lacking 6 bugfix/security releases behind upstream. Mumble has been reintroduced to Fedora a year ago [1,2], but the new maintainer seems to be inactive for quite a while now [3]. [1] https://fedoramagazine.org/mumble-returns-fedora/ [2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1284989 [3] https://badges.fedoraproject.org/user/fedpop
mumble-1.2.18-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-27c9b69c46
mumble-1.2.18-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-44ec236848
mumble-1.2.18-1.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-bfb78e83fc

mumble-1.2.18-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-bfb78e83fc
